frontmatter.title: How to Calculate GPA (Grade Point Average)
frontmatter.summary: Master GPA calculation with this comprehensive guide covering weighted and unweighted GPA, different grading scales, and tips for GPA improvement.

seo.metaDescription: Complete guide to calculating GPA including weighted and unweighted methods, different scales, and strategies for improvement.

steps.name: List Your Courses
steps.description: Write down all your courses with their letter grades and credit hours. Example: Math (A, 3 credits), English (B+, 3 credits), Science (A-, 4 credits)
steps.tip: Include all courses that count toward your GPA, but exclude pass/fail courses unless they affect GPA

steps.name: Convert Letter Grades to Points
steps.warning: Different schools may use different scales - check your institution's grading policy

steps.name: Calculate Grade Points
steps.description: Multiply each grade value by its credit hours. Math: 4.0 × 3 = 12.0, English: 3.3 × 3 = 9.9, Science: 3.7 × 4 = 14.8
steps.tip: Grade points represent the weighted value of each course based on credits

steps.name: Sum Total Grade Points
steps.description: Add all grade points together: 12.0 + 9.9 + 14.8 = 36.7 total grade points
steps.tip: Double-check your addition to avoid calculation errors

steps.name: Sum Total Credit Hours
steps.description: Add all credit hours: 3 + 3 + 4 = 10 total credit hours
steps.warning: Only include credit hours for courses that affect GPA

steps.name: Divide to Get GPA
steps.description: GPA = Total Grade Points ÷ Total Credit Hours = 36.7 ÷ 10 = 3.67
steps.tip: Round to 2 decimal places for most purposes

steps.name: For Weighted GPA (Optional)
steps.description: Add bonus points for advanced courses: AP/IB courses often add 1.0, Honors add 0.5. Recalculate with these bonuses
steps.warning: Weighted GPA scales vary significantly between schools - some use 5.0, others 6.0 scales

steps.name: Calculate Cumulative GPA
steps.description: To include previous semesters: Add all grade points from all semesters, divide by total credit hours from all semesters
steps.tip: Keep a running record of your grade points and credit hours each semester

content: GPA (Grade Point Average) is a standardized way to measure academic achievement. This guide covers everything from basic GPA calculation to understanding weighted GPAs and improving your academic standing. Whether you're a high school student preparing for college or a university student tracking your progress, mastering GPA calculation is essential.
